snippet: Mitt Romney’s campaign accused Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. of trying “to mislead the American public” in remarks about the Benghazi episode during the debate.
abstract: Obama administration's handling of attack on American diplomatic post in Benghazi, Libya, has opened new front in presidential campaign just weeks before Election Day as Republicans seize on it to questions Pres Obama's performance as commander in chief.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and TRIP GABRIEL
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Trip Gabriel from Richmond, Va.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s campaign accused Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. of trying “to mislead the American public” in remarks about the Benghazi episode during the debate.

headline.seo: New Front in Campaign as G.O.P. Seizes on Libya Actions
headline.main: New Front in Campaign as G.O.P. Seizes on Libya Attack
headline.print_headline: New Front in Race as Republicans Seize On Libya
